items.description: The bank account(s) number(s) of the vendor. This is the account to which the payment should be made. Extract all the relevant bank account numbers mentioned in the invoice.

contractNumber.description: It's a contract number between the carrier and Forto Logistics SE & Co KG.

from.description: The currency code from which the exchange rate is applied.

fxRate.description: The exchange rate applied to convert the amount from the 'from' currency to the 'to' currency.

to.description: The currency code to which the exchange rate is applied.

dueDate.description: The date by which the payment should be made by Forto Logistics SE & Co KG. Do Not calculate dueDate based on issueDate or any other date. Extract it directly from the invoice.

eta.description: Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) is the expected date when the shipment will arrive at its destination.

etd.description: Estimated Time of Departure (ETD) is the expected date when the shipment will leave the origin port.

fortoEntity.description: The entity of 'Forto Logistics SE & Co KG' that is responsible for the invoice. The Forto organization or branch managing the shipment.

hblNumber.description: House Bill of Lading number, a document issued by a freight forwarder.

currencyCode.description: The currency code in which the invoice is issued, such as EUR, USD, etc.

grandTotal.description: The total amount of the invoice, including all line items and taxes.

vatAmount.description: The total VAT amount applied to the invoice. This is the tax charged on the vatApplicableAmount of the invoice. Bitte Zahlen is not the vatAmount.

vatApplicableAmount.description: The amount on which VAT is applicable. This is the net amount before VAT is applied (without VAT).

vatPercentage.description: The percentage rate of VAT applied to the vatApplicableAmount. This is used to calculate the vatAmount.

invoiceNumber.description: The unique identifier for the invoice. This is used to track and reference the invoice in financial records.

issueDate.description: The date when the invoice was issued.

uniqueId.description: A line item can belong to a different shipments. Hence, the unique IDs of a line item need to be extracted that you see only on the line item level. UniqueIds are containerNumber, shipmentId, or sealNumber.

lineItemDescription.description: A description of the line item (COGS or Customs line items), which can include details about the service provided.

totalAmount.description: The total amount for the line item, which may include the cost of services, and applicable taxes.

totalAmountCurrency.description: The currency code for the total amount, such as EUR, USD, etc.

totalAmountEuro.description: The total amount converted to Euro, if applicable. You can find it by looking for the term 'Total EUR' or 'Amount in Euro' in the line item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item or service provided in the line item.

unitPrice.description: The price per unit of the item or service in the line item. Check the naming in a different languages, such as 'Einzelpreis', 'Unit Price', 'Prezzo unitario', 'Preis pro Einheit', etc.. Refer to 'Prezzo unitario' field in the italian invoice example

unitPriceCurrency.description: The currency code for the unit price, such as EUR, USD, etc.

vatAmount.description: The VAT amount applied to the line item. This is the tax charged on the totalAmount of the line item.

vatPercentage.description: The percentage rate of VAT applied to the totalAmount of the line item. This is used to calculate the vatAmount.

containerNumber.description: The container number associated with the line item. containerNumber MUST start with 4 letters followed by 7 digits (e.g., CMAU1234567)

containerSize.description: The size of the container associated with the containerNumber, such as 20ft, 40ft, 40HC, 20DC etc.
